paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 variant T618I, including clinical significance, penetrance data, and functional studies.

patients.demographics: Chinese family with a history of nocturnal sudden death
patients.phenotype: shortened rate-corrected QT intervals (mean QTc interval of 316 ms)

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Four of eleven family members evaluated exhibited shortened rate-corrected QT intervals (with a mean QTc interval of 316 ms).

functional_data.summary: The T618I mutation produces a more modest effect on repolarising IhERG than reported previously for the N588K-hERG variant 1 SQTS mutation.

variants.segregation_data: The T618I variant was absent in 200 ethnically matched controls, suggesting segregation with disease.
variants.additional_notes: The study involved a family with a history of sudden death, indicating potential clinical relevance.
key_quotes: Four of eleven family members evaluated exhibited shortened rate-corrected QT intervals (with a mean QTc interval of 316 ms).
Genotyping of the proband identified a base transition (C1853T) that led to a threonine to isoleucine substitution at position 618.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data extracted from the main text.
